showScoreExcerpt: “Once you get to huge Broadway houses, claustrophobia is harder to maintain... But it was also fun to see the production swing so hard at genre tropiness. If it doesn’t fully succeed on its own terms, it’s at least a solid reminder that terror is as worthy of drama as any other kind of spectacle.”

keyPhrases.quote: If it doesn't fully succeed on its own terms
it's at least a solid reminder that terror is as worthy of drama as any other kind of spectacle
it was also fun to see the production swing so hard at genre tropiness

llmScore.reasoning: Claude: The critic acknowledges the production doesn't fully succeed but appreciates its ambition and genre approach, suggesting a qualified mixed recommendation that leans slightly positive.
